thread.title_full: Boy, six, with brain tumor given eight months to live | Daily Mail Online

author: Mary Kekatos For Dailymail.Com
title: Boy, six, with brain tumor given eight months to live | Daily Mail Online
text: Boy, six, is given eight months to live after he went to the hospital for snowboarding concussion - and scan revealed inoperable brain tumor Devin Suau, six, was snowboarding with his family when he fell and hit his head His parents feared that he had a concussion but doctors instead found a tumor Based on the lower part of his brain stem, it is inoperable and terminal The Massachusetts boy was given between eight months and two years to live His parents are now working to raise awareness so Devin has a shot at survival Published: 21:02 GMT, 23 February 2017 | Updated: 21:38 GMT, 23 February 2017 7 shares
